law.catch_line: State Treasurer may perform duties of county attorney.
law.text: If the county attorney declines to perform the duties imposed upon him by this chapter, they may be performed by the State Treasurer. When he considers it to the best interest of the state, the State Treasurer may institute any action authorized by this chapter to be brought by the county attorney, or join the county attorney in the active prosecution of the action.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 58, sec. 15, effective March 10, 1994; and ch. 276, sec. 15, effective July 15, 1994. -- Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 17, sec. 49, effective January 1, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1618.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/94). This section was amended by 1994 Ky. Acts chs. 58 and 276. Where these Acts are not in conflict, they have been codified together. Where a conflict exists, Acts ch. 276, which was last enacted by the General Assembly, prevails under KRS 446.250.
